leadAgency: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA)
notes: Alabama received $203.4M for FY2026. ADECA is the lead agency. The ARHTP Project Narrative is available on the program page. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet. The state is in early implementation stages following the Dec 29, 2025 CMS award announcement.

leadAgency: Alaska Department of Health
notes: Alaska received $272.2M/year for 5 years. DOH aims to open a portal for registration and letter of intent in February 2026; funding awards expected Spring 2026. Alaska Community Foundation (ACF) awarded the subrecipient administrator contract to manage applications and distribute funds. Eligible entities: health care providers, Tribal Health Organizations, hospitals, clinics, behavioral health orgs, local governments, schools, workforce training programs, technology/innovation partners, child care providers, CBOs, nonprofits. Multiple application cycles planned. Scoring rubric will be posted publicly. Contact: RHTP@alaska.gov. Sign up for updates via GovDelivery.

leadAgency: Arizona Center for Rural Health / AHCCCS / ADHS
notes: Arizona received $167.0M for FY2026 (ranked 22nd per rural resident). No formal downstream funding opportunities open yet. Expected March/April 2026 pending state revised budget submission (Jan 30, 2026) and CMS approval. Four priority areas: Rural Health Education & Training (25%), Behavioral/Maternal/Chronic Disease (15%), Telehealth/Innovation (22%), Medical Equipment & Technology (23%). Lead agencies: Office of Economic Opportunity, AHCCCS, ADHS. Arizona Center for Rural Health offers letters of support via online form at redcap.link/7bkadhsh.

leadAgency: Office of Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders
notes: Arkansas received $208.8M for FY2026. The Governor's office led the application. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet. The state is in early implementation stages.

leadAgency: California Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI)
notes: California received $233.6M for FY2026. HCAI/CalSORH is the lead. Still in planning phase. Stakeholders encouraged to join the Rural Health email listserv for updates on webinars, surveys, and engagement opportunities. Contact: CalSORH@hcai.ca.gov or CalRHT@hcai.ca.gov. RHTP Program Overview, Project Narrative, Budget Narrative, and Project Abstract available on program page.

leadAgency: Colorado Department of Health Care Policy and Financing (HCPF)
notes: Colorado received $200.1M for FY2026. HCPF is actively developing RFA materials. RHTP Advisory Committee applications open through February 16, 2026 via Google Form. First committee meeting planned for March 2026. Eligible providers in 52 rural/frontier Colorado counties should monitor for RFA release. Cooperative agreement with CMS must be finalized before funding distribution decisions. Contact: hcpf_RHTP@state.co.us. Newsletter signup available via Constant Contact.

leadAgency: Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
notes: Connecticut received $154.2M for FY2026. The state has NOT yet received authorization from CMS to distribute funds; subject to additional negotiation and review. Funding restricted to federally approved projects. Multiple state agencies collaborating: DSS, Governor's Office, OPM, DPH, DMHAS, DCF. Check back regularly and monitor state procurement website. Public Comment page available on program site.

leadAgency: Delaware Division of Public Health
notes: Delaware received $157.4M for FY2026. The Rural Health Transformation Plan addresses healthcare disparities for approximately 400,000 residents in rural Sussex and Kent Counties. Subrecipients will be selected through a procurement process. Application documents shared via Dropbox. No specific downstream opportunity details posted yet.

leadAgency: Florida Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA)
notes: Florida received $209.9M for FY2026. AHCA leads 15 key initiatives spanning: access to care, behavioral health, telehealth/virtual specialty clinics, tele-ICU, workforce development, payment reform, remote patient monitoring, and nutrition/social determinants. No downstream subgrant/vendor opportunities posted yet. Contact for updates available on program page. Grant application and committee presentation available for download.

leadAgency: Georgia Department of Community Health (DCH)
notes: Georgia received $218.9M for FY2026 under the 'GREAT Health' program (Georgia Rural Enhancement and Transformation of Health). One of the largest awards among 50 states. DCH collected public input from Aug 11-29, 2025 via town halls (4 events, 150+ comments). Projects prioritized: support rural providers (population â‰¤50,000), completable within 24 months, avoid ongoing state obligations. Further details on eligible entities and application processes to be released. DCH program page will serve as primary info source.

leadAgency: Executive Office of the State of Hawaii
notes: Hawaii received $188.9M for FY2026. The Executive Office led the application. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Idaho Department of Health and Welfare (DHW)
notes: Idaho received $186.0M for FY2026. Funding will be subawarded in accordance with Idaho procurement law. Public input survey conducted Sept 5-30, 2025. No specific RFA/RFP or subaward details available yet. Contact: IdahoRHTP@dhw.idaho.gov.

leadAgency: Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services (HFS)
notes: Illinois received $193.4M for FY2026. HFS applied for $1B total ($200M/year over 5 years). Three initiative categories: Transforming Rural Healthcare, Overcoming Geographic Barriers to Care, Building a Resilient Rural Workforce. No downstream subgrant or vendor opportunities posted yet.

leadAgency: Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA) / Indiana Department of Health
notes: Indiana received $206.9M for FY2026 for 'GROW: Cultivating Hoosier Health' initiative. After CMS submission, the state began assessing vendor needs with follow-ups to occur as RFIs or RFPs 'in the near future.' Monitor Indiana Department of Administration current business opportunities: in.gov/idoa/procurement/current-business-opportunities/. Contact: GrowRuralHealth@health.in.gov. Documentation available: Project Summary, Full Project Narrative, Budget Narrative, Rural Community Health Survey Results.

leadAgency: Iowa Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Iowa received $209.0M for FY2026 under 'Healthy Hometowns' plan. The proposal aims to build a high-quality, sustainable system of care in rural communities. Project Narrative and Project Summary available on program page. No downstream subgrant or vendor opportunities posted yet.

leadAgency: Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE)
notes: Kansas received $221.9M for FY2026. KDHE led the application with stakeholder and community engagement. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services (CHFS) / Dept for Public Health
notes: Kentucky received $212.9M for FY2026 under 'Team Kentucky Rural Health Transformation.' Five interrelated initiatives planned. Regional funds will be awarded via competitive RFA with committee scoring/oversight. Led by RHTP Grant Director within HFS with Executive Oversight and State Steering Committees. Key initiatives include: 24/7 Medical Operations Coordination Center, EMR referral module connecting ~450 rural entities to HIE, 'Rooted in Health' Rural Dental Access Program. Monitor: ruralhealthplan.ky.gov and finance.ky.gov/eProcurement.

leadAgency: Louisiana Department of Health (LDH)
notes: Louisiana received $208.4M for FY2026. LDH indicated notification of funding opportunities expected January 2026 after CMS Year 1 funding distribution. Contact: RHTP@la.gov for information or to share input.

leadAgency: Maine Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Maine received $190.0M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Maryland Department of Health
notes: Maryland received $168.2M for FY2026. Application includes project narrative, project summary, and stakeholder/community listening session resources. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Massachusetts Executive Office of Health and Human Services (EOHHS)
notes: Massachusetts received $162.0M for FY2026. Application discusses rural health needs, facility viability, proposed initiatives, metrics/evaluation, sustainability plan. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS)
notes: Michigan received $173.1M for FY2026. MDHHS engaged with rural health providers, community partners, Medicaid beneficiaries, and rural community residents to inform strategy. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Minnesota Department of Health
notes: Minnesota received $193.1M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Mississippi State Department of Health
notes: Mississippi received $205.9M for FY2026. No state-specific RHTP program page was identified. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Missouri Department of Social Services
notes: Missouri received $216.3M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)
notes: Montana received $233.5M for FY2026. Fund distribution plans being designed; finalization expected after January 30 budget deadline. Most initiatives will involve competitive bidding via bids.mt.gov. Alternative approaches include grant applications and inter-agency contracts. Eligible applicants: tribal nations, government agencies, health care providers, educational institutions, nonprofits, and other partners. Sign up for updates at ruralhealth.mt.gov. Contact: HHSRuralHealthTransformation@mt.gov.

leadAgency: Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Nebraska received $218.5M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Nevada Health Authority
notes: Nevada received $179.9M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services
notes: New Hampshire received $204.0M for FY2026, the largest award among New England states. Focus includes expanding CCBHCs for behavioral health/SUD integration. Implementation planning underway. Monitor: dhhs.nh.gov RHTP page and Open RFPs page. No downstream subgrant or vendor application posted yet.

leadAgency: New Jersey Department of Health
notes: New Jersey received $147.3M for FY2026 (smallest state award). RFA HAS BEEN POSTED. First annual project/budget period: Feb 1, 2026 - Oct 30, 2026 (OBBBA funding period Dec 31, 2025 - Oct 30, 2026). Applications evaluated through electronic grants system. Applicants may apply to one or more activities (Activity A, B, C, and/or D) with separate submissions required for each. Apply via NJ DOH Notice of Grant portal.

leadAgency: New Mexico Health Care Authority (HCA)
notes: New Mexico received $211.5M for FY2026. HCA previously issued RFP 26-630-8000-0007 for 'Consultant Support for RHTP Application' which closed September 17, 2025. This was for consultant support, NOT downstream subgrants. No downstream subgrant or vendor application has been posted yet for actual program implementation.

leadAgency: New York State Department of Health
notes: New York received $212.1M for FY2026. Four initiatives: Rural Community Health Integration, Technology-Enhanced Primary Care (PCMH with AI), Rural Roots Workforce Development, Technology Innovation/Cybersecurity. January 16, 2026 presentation available on program page. No downstream subgrant or vendor RFA posted yet. Contact: RHTP@health.ny.gov.

leadAgency: North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (NCDHHS)
notes: North Carolina received $213.0M for FY2026. Six integrated initiatives: workforce, access, technology, behavioral health, chronic disease, payment models. 420+ stakeholders engaged. Details on funding flow, subgrants, and payment mechanisms will be shared after CMS approval and through future RFAs. NCDHHS will post application info on RHTP webpage following state/federal administrative steps. No more than 10% for administrative expenses. FAQ page available. Monitor: ncdhhs.gov RHTP page.

leadAgency: North Dakota Health and Human Services
notes: North Dakota received $198.9M for FY2026. Subaward opportunities anticipated release January 2026 on a rolling basis. Provider Readiness Survey conducted November 2025. Awards will require agreement between HHS and awarded entity. State aims to limit administrative burden. Award process includes mechanism to prioritize impact to communities in need and/or tribal and rural/frontier communities. Contact: rhtp@nd.gov.

leadAgency: Ohio Department of Health
notes: Ohio received $202.0M for FY2026. Application includes Executive Summary and Project Narrative; webinar held during application development. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Oklahoma State Department of Health
notes: Oklahoma received $223.5M for FY2026. Application includes project narrative and budget narrative. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Oregon Health Authority (OHA)
notes: Oregon received $197.3M for FY2026. Three funding distribution mechanisms planned: (1) Catalyst Awards - competitive applications across three initiatives for ready-to-go projects (Healthy Communities & Prevention, Workforce Capacity & Resilience, Technology & Data Modernization); (2) Immediate Impact Awards - direct/non-competitive for state-identified opportunities; (3) Regional Sustainability Awards - subcontractors for rural health network facilitation/TA, Phase 2 competitive. RFGA release Spring 2026, response deadline early summer, awards mid-2026. No limits on entity types. Rural defined as 10+ miles from population center of 40,000+. Contact: RHTP@oha.oregon.gov.

leadAgency: Pennsylvania Department of Human Services
notes: Pennsylvania received $193.3M for FY2026. $200M/year x 5 years = $1B requested. Funds flowing through eight regional PREP (Partnerships for Regional Economic Performance) organizations, PA AHEC, University of Pittsburgh Medicaid Research Center, and other partners. No specific downstream RFA or vendor application posted yet. Full Rural Health Transformation Plan PDF linked on program page.

leadAgency: Rhode Island Department of Health (RIDOH) / EOHHS
notes: Rhode Island received $156.2M for FY2026. Interest form available to join listserv. EOHHS Rural Health Transformation Grant Initiative page has potential additional updates. Five strategic goals: Making Rural America Healthy Again, Sustainable Access, Workforce Development, Innovative Care, Tech Innovation. Contact: RIDOH.OPCRH@health.ri.gov. Monitor EOHHS page for downstream opportunity announcements.

leadAgency: South Carolina Department of Health and Human Services
notes: South Carolina received $200.0M for FY2026. Plan targets rural health disparities through: 'Connections to Care' program, Tech Catalyst Fund for rural health technology startups, mobile health units, workforce development, provider training. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: South Dakota Department of Health
notes: South Dakota received $189.5M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Tennessee Department of Health
notes: Tennessee received $206.9M for FY2026 under 'Rural Health Access for Tennessee's Future.' Plan proposes investment reversing rural hospital decline, extending care access, modernizing technology, strengthening local economies, improving outcomes for mothers/children/older adults. Full application document available as PDF. Related: TN Rural Health Care Center of Excellence at UTHSC has separate grants (planning up to $100K, implementation up to $500K, deadline Jan 15, 2026). Contact: Rural.Health@tn.gov. Monitor TN DOH rural health page and Central Procurement Office for RFPs.

leadAgency: Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC)
notes: Texas received $281.3M for FY2026, the LARGEST state award. 'Rural Texas Strong' six-part strategy: Lone Star Advanced AI and Telehealth, Infrastructure and Capital Investments, Make Rural Texans Healthy Again (wellness/nutrition), workforce development, cybersecurity, equipment upgrades. HHSC will use a competitive process to attract and select funding recipients. Eligible applicants: local governments, rural hospitals, rural FQHCs, rural behavioral health providers, and other qualified applicants. Applications expected in spring 2026. Monitor: HHSC Grants webpage at hhs.texas.gov.

leadAgency: Utah Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Utah received $195.7M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Vermont Agency of Human Services
notes: Vermont received $195.1M for FY2026 under 'Vermont H.R.1/Rural Health Transformation Fund.' No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS)
notes: Virginia received $189.5M for FY2026 under 'VA Rural Vitality' initiative. Four key initiatives: CareIQ, Homegrown Health Heroes, Connected Care Closer to Home, Live Well Together. Application submitted by DMAS. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Washington State Health Care Authority
notes: Washington received $181.3M for FY2026. Proposed financial assistance to support healthcare workforce housing for clinical and support staff. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.

leadAgency: Office of Governor Patrick Morrisey
notes: West Virginia received $199.5M for FY2026. At least $500M over program lifetime. Governor developed seven flagship initiatives. Detailed Summary, Federal Requirements, Strategic Priorities, Flagship Initiatives, and Public Input Process documents available on program page. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet. Contact: 304.558.2000.

leadAgency: Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS)
notes: Wisconsin received $203.7M for FY2026. Three initiatives: strengthen rural health workforce, drive rural technology/innovation, transform rural care through partnerships. DHS will select a vendor to help implement the program. Competitive grants planned for rural regions across seven Healthcare Emergency Readiness Coalitions regions. DHS currently recruiting management team. Sign up for email updates on program page. No specific RFA or application details posted yet.

leadAgency: Wyoming Department of Health
notes: Wyoming received $205.0M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
